messages.title: A Conservative majority government can get on with the country’s priorities
messages.content: Get Brexit done with a deal – we’ve agreed a deal with the EU. And it’s ready to go: it protects jobs, the economy, workers’ rights, and our environment.

messages.title: It’s a Conservative majority or a hung parliament
Don’t risk five long years of Corbyn in charge

keyPolicies.policyDescription: £33.9 billion extra for the NHS – to fund 40 new hospitals and invest in 50,000 more NHS staff including nurses and GP appointments.
20,000 extra police officers – and trusting our police with the powers they need to make our streets safer.
More funding for every pupil in every school – so every child gets a better education, no matter what.

mentions.candidate: every local vote in Putney will make the difference.
mentions.tacticalSituation: Just a handful of votes could decide this seat so this election will be very close.

issues.brexitEurope: Get Brexit done with a deal.
issues.economy: It protects jobs and the economy.
issues.education: More funding for every pupil in every school – so every child gets a better education, no matter what.
issues.health: £33.9 billion extra for the NHS – to fund 40 new hospitals and invest in 50,000 more NHS staff including nurses and GP appointments.

quotes.text: Polls teeter between hung parliament and slim Tory majority
The Lib Dems have ruled out a coalition with the Conservatives. So a hung parliament means Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister.
Corbyn would have to be propped up by the Scottish Nationalists. And they’re demanding ANOTHER referendum to break up Britain.

images.caption: Infographics showing '326 seats needed for a majority' and bar graphs representing different parties.
